dialogue.raw_text: Did you know the original Goths were a Germanic tribe that settled in Rome? They didn't wear black. They wore regular linen tunics. I don't know why nobody else knows that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Needy enters the gym and slams the door shut behind her. People ignore her as she slowly walks toward the stage. They're too busy slow dancing and laughing in their respective cliques. She looks up at the stage, where Soft Shoulder are playing an insufferably long coda. Nikolai noodles through a guitar solo, then looks up and sees Needy looking directly at him, her eyes full of hate. Nikolai gulps nervously and elbows Dirk. Needy points to her eyes with two fingers, then points at Nikolai, as if to say, Gotcha. She looks completely possessed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dirk takes one look at Needy's face and takes off his guitar. Nikolai motions for the rest of the band to leave the stage. The music stops abruptly. The kids in the gym murmur and complain, confused. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Dirk) We gotta get out of here.

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think this girl's flipping out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What could she do to us?

direction.raw_text: : Needy tries to follow them. She limps blindly toward the stage and climbs up. Everyone watches, gasping in horror. By now the band is disappearing out the side door of the gym.

dialogue.raw_text: .O. They found Chip the following morning. The police couldn't find an explanation for the "substance" in the pool, so they chose not to mention it to the press. In fact, they treated the whole incident like a bad dream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see the POLICE (including newly minted officer ROMAN DUDA) informing Chip's mother that his body has been found. She collapses onto the floor, curling up into the fetal position.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Trouble was, some of us would never wake up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Needy is lying in bed, shaking, her arm in a cast. Her mother tries to rouse her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Needy pulls the covers over her head. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: .O. I never went back to school after that. Didn't talk much either. My mom bought some books so she could teach me at home like crazy Christians with 14 kids do. But I wasn't a very cooperative student.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Toni shrugs, resigned, and tosses the book on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Needy is crouched outside Jennifer's window, hiding in the shrubbery. She looks almost feral, with wide eyes and a hungry expression. Through the window, we see Jennifer sitting at a vanity and combing her hair, oblivious to the intruder in her yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see Jennifer putting the comb down and examining her hair with a appraising eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Needy creeps away from the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: .O. What nobody realized was that I was doing a different kind of homework. I was watching her every night. Waiting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .O. (CONT'D) Waiting for her to get weak and dull. Waiting for her to burn through the life-force she'd stolen from Chip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .O. (CONT'D) It took weeks, but I finally made my move. Remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We're seeing a FLASHBACK of the night Needy slaughtered Jennifer. Needy plunging through the window. Jennifer thrashing. The blood. The struggle. The levitation. The arrival of the police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see, for a moment, Jennifer's sly, challenging smile as Needy raises the boxcutter to slash her. That signature look of mastery and control. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: .O. Even in her last moments of life, she somehow managed to be cooler than me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see Jennifer's mother holding her again, screaming, though all we hear is SILENCE and STATIC. Sure enough, Jennifer's bleeding body seems to be artfully, sensually draped in her mother's arms. She almost seems to be
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She left an insanely hot corpse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: at us.

direction.raw_text: We're back in solitary confinement, where Needy has been narrating the whole sordid tale. She hasn't moved a muscle since beginning her story. Only a single shaft of moonlight illuminates the room. An orderly shoves DINNER through a slot in the door. It's a pile of mystery meat. Needy wrinkes her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Needy reaches up and distractedly pulls back the neckline of her shirt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the moonlight, we see Needy still has a infected- looking BITEMARK near her shoulder. She scratches it, wincing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: .O. I don't even know who Needy Lesnicki is anymore. I'm a different person now. A person who uses curse words and kicks orderlies and and sees things that aren't there. A very bad, very damaged person.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .O. (CONT'D) But sometimes, change can be good. For instance, most occult scholars don't know this, but if you're bitten by a demon--and you live-- you just might absorb some of the demon's abilities.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .O. (CONT'D) You just might get lucky for once in your miserable life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Needy strolls across the grounds in her bunny slippers. She heads confidently toward the SECURITY FENCE and passes through it after casually mangling the bars. Only a Needy-shaped hole remains.

direction.raw_text: Needy is striding purposefully down a dark country road. The hospital recedes in the background. A few RACCOONS gather by the side of the road, watching Needy as she walks past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: whizzes by with its windows rolled down. "Through the Trees" blasts from the radio. Needy begins to sing, a lopsided grin on her face.

dialogue.raw_text: "Through the trees, I will find you. Heal the ruins left inside you..."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Devil's Kettle citizens are gathered around Murphy Pool, crying. It's a CANDLELIGHT MEMORIAL for Chip. Their faces are weary and sorrowful. Photos of Chip have been arranged around the edge of the fence. We see a picture of CHIP AND NEEDY on the end. Someone has brought a CD player, and the mourners sing along, their voices soaring.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: "...And the stars will remind you, we'll meet again..."

direction.raw_text: Needy holds her thumb aloft as she walks down the remote country highway. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: A small creek emptying into a stream   runs parallel to the road. Needy seems something glinting   at the mouth of the creek and stoops to pick it up. It's   Nikolai's BOWIE KNIFE, the one he threw into Devil's   Kettle, never to be seen again. Needy picks it up and tucks it into her waistband.

dialogue.raw_text: East, huh? Guess I'm headed that way. But I'm gonna need you to pay me in ass, gas or grass. Got that? No free rides in this wagon.
